title: (04700) El Ejido - 21 Calle José de Churriguera
title_short: (04700) El Ejido - 21 Calle José de Churriguera
description: Drinking water fountain

title: (04700) El Ejido - 9 A-389
description: Laundromat

title: (04700) El Ejido - 14 Calle Pericles
description: Parking next to the stadium, ideal for windy days because the wall protects a little. Sloping and roadside but not very noisy. Not amazing but fine for a one night transit

title: (04700) El Ejido - S.N Avenida del Oasis
title_short: (04700) El Ejido - S.N Avenida del Oasis
description: Repsol station the only place 100 km away to get lpg / lpg gas station of course and like in all Repsol there is water next to the air. It does not flow quickly but it has the merit of existing. There are shops all around, eg Mac'do Lidl etc.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 10 Diseminado Ctra Almerimar
description: Great car wash, good up to around 4m high. You can also insert coins

title: (04716) El Ejido - 7 Calle Gorrión
description: laundromat

title: (04715) El Ejido - 57 Calle Rastro
description: Picnic area with barbecue and tables. Very shaded good for a break

title: (04750) Dalías - 3T Avenida de las Alpujarras
description: Parking near the typical town center. Nice walks possible. No services, no supply or disposal. There is a bakery directly opposite. There is a fountain in the market square.

title: (04750) Celín - C. Real de Celín
description: Very nice place very quiet with a very beautiful view 10 camping car possible

title: (04715) El Ejido - 98 Paraje Matagorda
description: Very cheap fuel. Drain gray and black water. Drinking water fill free. Also the possibility to wash and vacuum the camper. (with small change). Friendly staff. Thank you for the good service, compliment!

title: (04750) Celín - 3A Calle Mergas
description: Ground parking, with easy access and where you can make routes on foot or by bicycle in the surroundings in beautiful natural places, there is also a bar and shop next door.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 1 Calle Mascarón
description: Large car park without any prohibitions, unlike all car parks by the sea.

title: (04712) El Ejido - 42 Calle Pescadores
description: Turn off drinking water near a supermarket

title: (04715) El Ejido - 10 Calle Aparejo
description: Parking next to the lagoon. Went to park here tonight but there are sign saying no Motorhomes and massive fines if you do however follow road towards sea for 1km further and there is very large carpark overlooking sea with no signs so we stayed here. If it’s noisy etc I will update.

title: (04713) Berja - 42 Carretera de Málaga
description: Lowcost gas station with bank card and in the supply store sells bottles of butane camping gas

name: Camping Mar Azul
title: (04712) Camping Mar Azul
description:
Just 5 km from the "826 - Balerma" exit of the A7 motorway. 
Next to the beach and the town of Balerma. Plots from 70 to 140 m2 with water, drainage, 16 Amp electricity and Wi-Fi. We accept pets except in the bungalows.

Ideal for stopovers: emptying and filling tanks, car wash, tire pressure control, Gas Repsol, Cepsa and CampingGas, Sat TV technician, mechanic 1 km away, washers, dryers and ironing. Mail and parcel service. ACSI Card.
Fresh bread all day in the canteen. Pool, Rent a Car, bus stop.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 2 Calle Salazón
description: Asphalt parking with 6 large spaces possible for CCs at least mid November since we are alone. Garbage cans nearby. Lighted, flat and clean. Facing the sea so very windy but the islanders that we are adore! Possible walk for dogs who like to find a little green grass in the region. We slept one night without a problem and the police who came by in the evening didn't tell us anything. Many thanks to the city.

title: (04711) Almerimar - Unnamed Road
description: Huge free mixed car park accessible to any size of motorhome sea 50 meters away access to the promenade which runs along the beach there is also a cycle path drinking water at the beach parking and sleeping there in winter no problem as long as you do not not unpack table chairs etc

title: (04711) El Ejido - 2 Plaza de la Bancada
title_short: (04711) El Ejido - 2 Plaza de la Bancada
description: Next to a wind spot. Large car park. Showers on the beach and public toilets. Rental of wind equipment at a reasonable price and lessons. Perfect wind and calm sea. Free parking.

title: (04715) El Ejido - AL-9036
description: Long strip of parking along the beach, good swimming opportunities, beach OK for local standards, surroundings not particularly nice due to the greenhouses. Also suitable for thick ships.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 22 Paseo las Olas
description: Large graveled surface on the beach, plenty of places, fairly easy access, we have a 12-ton plow and 10m long. We settled a little higher up, because the lower places were all occupied by ten motorhomes. The beach is not exceptional but for board sports enthusiasts it is perfect. Garbage cans are available on the beach. The place is pretty clean.

title: (04713) Balanegra - 5 Paseo Marítimo
description: Good Place TO dive. Big Free Park. With Free Wc,bar near and in front of beach.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 14 Calle Sotavento
description: Asphalt parking next to the beach with 6 spaces for large vehicles. Showers and public toilets on the beach. Camping behaviour forbidden by sign.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 20 Calle del Muro
description: Parking of the old guards of the castle. spectacular views.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 2 Plaza a Piramide
description: Almerimar near the parking lot of the marina.

title: (04715) Guardias Viejas - P.º las Olas
description: Nice flat area with other vans parked there. Water available at the shower point on the beach. Superb views of Almerimar across the bay. Nice small corner shop in the village. Castle worth going to 2km away. Bins not far from the shower point.

title: (04715) El Ejido - AL-9036
description: Seaside. Full nature quiet several possible locations on 200 meters, below the castle to visit. Good fishing spot, out of season we stayed one night without problem.

title: (04715) Los Baños de Guardias Viejas -
description: A quiet place lulled by the sound of the waves. The police came by twice but didn't tell us anything, we slept very well, garbage cans are available so leave this natural place clean

name: Parking de autocaravanas Puerto Deportivo de Almerimar
title: (04711) Parking de autocaravanas Puerto Deportivo de Almerimar
title_short: (04711) Parking de autocaravanas Puerto Deportivo de Almerimar
description: Bon Aire in the harbor with waste disposal and fresh water. Hot showers with toilets available key obtained only at reception with deposit. Short walk required so showers don't close on other side of marina. The views are stunning and there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby as well as a supermarket.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 10 Paraje el Montecillo
description: In front of the sea

title: (04715) El Ejido - 39 Paraje Guardias Viejas
description: Natural beach, without much traffic, ideal for sleeping. To get here, beware of heavy motorhomes as the sand can block them.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 36 Calle Mar de Alborán
title_short: (04711) El Ejido - 36 Calle Mar de Alborán
description:
Part of the port but less busy and quieter than the other side. Right next to the beach. Fenced and secure. Access by checking in with the harbor master (speaks English and German) to pay and get the key to access the car park and toilets/showers. Water & electricity included. 4G but TV (with antenna) not good.
ATTENTION: First go to the port office GPS 36.69640, -2.79420

title: (04713) Berja - 28 Poligono Sector R-1
description: It is a very quiet place, we spent the night here. The next day we took advantage of it to be on the beach, since there was no one there. One km from the town of Balanegra, access is somewhat complicated for AC, with a camper you can access without problem, but be careful, there was some garbage, but when we arrived we picked it up to make our stay more pleasant ☺️

title: (04710) Las Cantinas - Unnamed Road
description: The Mountain of Power (Peñón de Bernal) or The Temple of Thulsa Doom from Conan the Barbarian. It's an old movie set. The driveway is quite adventurous, as there is only one road that leads through a greenhouse plantation and it doesn't work with the Navi Tom tom. The coordinates are best driven with maps. 2 vehicles fit directly at the foot of the mountain. A few cyclists and cars during the day, completely quiet at night.

title: (04711) Almerimar - Av. Almerimar
description: On the edge of ALMERIMAR just at the start for hikes in the natural park Mixed lighted and tarmacked parking accessible to any size of motorhome parking possible by respecting the parking spaces Restaurant at the end of the beach parking lot Be careful not to unpack anything the parking lot is authorized day and night on condition that the equipment is not unpacked

title: (04745) La Mojonera - 14 A-358
description: Parking area in an industrial estate with good shade, there are few around here. ideal to eat and rest for a while next to the road, with containers.

title: (04746) La Mojonera - 7 Calle Oro
description: Repsol gas station, Poniente Transport City.N340, exit 420

title: (04760) Berja - 25 Carretera de Adra
description: Berja Gras and Schotteruntergrund area. Zum Zentrum ca. 300 meters. Nachts ruhig. Netter Ort mit Marktplatz und guten tappas. endlich KEIN Plastik in der Umgebung sondern wunderschöne Berge. Grosser mercadona im ort. Nutzung ist grstis.

title: (04779) Adra - 18 Carretera de Almería
description: Repsol gas station A bit hidden, to the left of the office where you can also access the toilets. Free - thank you very much!

title: (04717) El Ejido - 250 Paraje la Cumbre
description: This tree is in the middle of the route there are many birds and flora of all kinds cool

title: (04760) Berja - 96 Avenida Manuel Salmerón
description: Not far from the free parking lot of Berja. Here you can wash 10-15 kg of laundry for 6-8 euros. Machines are clean and smell good. Drying costs 2 euros for 15 minutes

title: (04779) La Curva - 15 Conjunto la Habana
description: Sandy parking on the beach, has garbage cans and showers, but a bit dirty.

name: Camping Las Vegas
title: (04779) Camping Las Vegas
description: Camping Las Vegas, nice little family campsite. Between greenhouse greenhouse and greenhouse but for a nice night.

title: (04760) Berja - Unnamed Road
description: Parking for buses at the top of the periurban park of Castala, in the park there are fountains and containers. Quiet at night on weekdays although with an influx of hikers during the day. Starting point of different hiking routes through the Sierra de Gádor.

title: (04770) Adra -
description:
Large rest area with washing station (large washer and dryer), water filling, gray emptying and chemical toilet. Restaurant and rest area. Lots of parked trucks.
It's also a petrol station with a grocery shop and a bakery (frech bagets etc.) you can do here all.

title: (04738) Puebla de Vícar - 107 Bulevar Ciudad de Vicar
title_short: (04738) Puebla de Vícar - 107 Bulevar Ciudad de Vicar
description: Self service laundry, dryer, very clean and tidy, there is a mini market next to it. There are bars and banks nearby. Open from 10:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.

title: (04769) Berja - Unnamed Road
description:
Spot for one or two in a bend of this decent and quiet track.
Very quiet day, super quiet night. 
Drinking water at the Castala Recreation Area (3 km).

no shade, no services, good view, nice sunset, okay stargazing.

title: (04738) Vícar - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking next to the cemetery with a view of the endless sea of greenhouses.
There is water and rubbish bins on the cemetery grounds. When we were there, the cemetery toilets were locked.
Unfortunately, there is a lot of rubbish around here. We collected two bags of rubbish. Together we can manage to leave the place cleaner than we found it.

title: () Adra - ALP-103
description: Repsol gas station with a bar and ample dirt parking, you can stay up late without a problem and I would even say that you can spend the night as well. The girl in the cafeteria is very nice and treats you very well. The cafeteria/bar is large and comfortable.

title: (04740) Almería - 5 Diseminado Cañada Algarrobo
description: BP gas station, with AC area for water change, WC, clean water.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar -
description: It's like a nature reserve. Definitely nice to stand and rest during the day BUT I wouldn't sleep there at night. Strange figures came around. One came and warned us that it was not safe to sleep there. According to his statement: Cars are often demolished and robbed there at night. Left the place right away. Road to drive very bumpy and potholes.

title: (04728) Felix - 15 Calle Tortuosa
description: At the end of the village car park there is space for 3 or 4 motorhomes. The rest of the parking spaces are smaller. Very picturesque town with a bakery and many restaurants. Hiking and mountain bike outings. Roquetas beach is a 15-minute drive away.

title: (04728) Felix - 17D Calle Primera del Campo
description:
Clay ground viewpoint with spectacular views. beautiful town of
the Alpujarras. There is a bakery and many restaurants. Next to the town parking lot, where there is also a place for large motorhomes in the background.

title: (04770) Adra - 16-42 Camino del Censo
description: Quiet place, in front of the promenade, and a step away from the beach, there is a beach bar, a children's park and a candy shop, the ldl can be reached by car. The beach is very clean and careful.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 1 Calle Cóndor
description: Quiet lighted verge, good for one night. Police drove by and said nothing.

title: (04770) Adra - Avenida del Trafalgar C.F.
description: Quiet parking by the sea to spend the night.

title: (04738) Vícar - AL-3400
description:
Flat area along steep mountainroad.
nothing fancy, some construction rubble.
nice view to SW (sunset   sea) 
OK for a night, quiet, hardly any traffic at night

title: (04738) Vícar - AL-3400
description: A flat area for parking on a viewpoint, its right next to a mountain road (good quality but narrow). Only a few cars passed in the morning. There is a bench for enjoying the sunset. Enough space for few vans. Spent the night without any problems

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 64 Calle Pintor Rosales
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 64 Calle Pintor Rosales
description: Very clean laundromat. Parking nearby. 10, 3x12, 16kg and 2x 16kg dryers.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 1 Calle de las Tiendas
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 1 Calle de las Tiendas
description: Near Lidl there is a very comfortable place.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 666 Avenida Sabinar
description: Parking on the side of the road with supermarket not too far away

name: Área autocaravanas Camper Park
title: (04740) Área autocaravanas Camper Park
description: Overnight Area for Motorhomes in Roquetas de Mar, Almería. Overnight services, drinking water, gray water emptying and chemical toilets, electricity in all plots, showers, toilets, laundry with dryer and washing machine, dish sinks, laundry rooms, free Wi-Fi 365 days, check out 12:00, pets accepted.

title: (04769) San Roque - Unnamed Road
description: Great views of the mountains and the sea. Unfortunately also on the greenhouses. There is also a lot of rubbish lying around here... Please take your rubbish with you and keep the environment clean... Above at the indicated position for one or two 4x4 vehicles. Below for two to three 4x4 vehicles. With a real off-road vehicle you can really let off steam here and drive even further. I only have four-wheel drive and not that much ground clearance... There are even more off-road tracks to explore in the vicinity!... But also mark tracks that are accessible to normal vehicles as such, thanks! Have fun!

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 45 Paseo los Baños
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 45 Paseo los Baños
description: Cheap laundry, large and in very good condition

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 40 Avenida Mariano Hernandez Caro
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 40 Avenida Mariano Hernandez Caro
description: Parking near the beach, proximity to supermarket churreria bars cashier.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 64 Avenida Unión Europea
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 64 Avenida Unión Europea
description: Automatic laundromat. 5 euros for a machine 12 kgs laundry and softener included. possibility to wash in 15 minutes for 3 euros. Provide money. Opening from 7h to 23h

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 22 Paseo el Mar
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 22 Paseo el Mar
description: Parking day forbidden to sleep and unpack only for small vehicle be careful the summer will be difficult

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 4 Calle Marina Mercante
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 4 Calle Marina Mercante
description: Self-service laundry (large place, lots of machines). Large uneven car park just 50 meters from the laundry. Within walking distance of the marina.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - C. Regidor
description: The only solution at this time as the parking lot of the Castle is closed for works. Small parking for campers under 6 meters in length. Ideal for a stop and a visit to the castle. Even if there are no prohibition signs, I don't think staying for the night is the best. Close rubbish bins. Flat area.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 260 Avenida Juan Carlos I
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 260 Avenida Juan Carlos I
description: A favorite for this car park 10 m from the beach, very quiet in winter. motorhomes tolerated in low season. great walk along the beach!

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - Avenida de la Aduana
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - Avenida de la Aduana
description: One of the three places in Roquetas reserved for motorhomes. Overnight allowed. Right on the beach and promenade and a restaurant. 15 places are reserved for mobile homes. Camping-like behavior is expressly forbidden by a sign and can be punished with heavy fines.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 8 Avenida Legión Española
title_short: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 8 Avenida Legión Española
description:
Regular parking along a long street, plenty of space for large motorhomes.

The gravel parking lot right next to the beach is for cars only, no camping or motorhomes, so stay on the street, and don't bring out awnings or furniture.

Trash cans are at the north end of the street.

title: (04721) Roquetas de Mar - 1 Avenida de la Fabriquilla P
title_short: (04721) Roquetas de Mar - 1 Avenida de la Fabriquilla P
description: Laundry

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 38 Poligono Sector 55
description: Beautiful little corner of nature very calm and peaceful with some magnificent palm trees. No on-site service but ideal for resting during the day and spending the night.

title: (04460) Fondón - Unnamed Road
description: Mahon fountain recreational area near the town of fondón great space to park very shaded area. Climbing area and ferrata near good place to ride a bicycle

title: (04720) Roquetas de Mar - Unnamed Road
description: Place on the outskirts of Roquetas, by the mountain area. Very calm.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 6 Calle Chillida
description: LPG station Repsol, Calle chillida

name: Camping Roquetas
title: (04720) Camping Roquetas
description: Good campsite, located between Aguadulce and Roquetas. Very comfortable for large vehicles and clean Services and needs of any kind covered, see the map on the website ("how to get there")

title: (18491) Turón -
description: Quiet place to spend the night without services with a lake view

title: (04720) Aguadulce - 305 Avenida de Carlos III
description: New laundry in the car wash. butane and propane can also be purchased. right in front is a Lidl to kill time while you finish washing

title: (04769) Berja - AL-6400
description: Parking overlooking lake (man made). Beside very little used road (with exceptions). The park authority checked something every two hours but did not bother us. Excellent walks nearby

title: (04769) Berja - AL-6400
description: Small car park 2/3 vehicles max, flat, very quiet overlooking the magnificent lake, night and day extremely quiet just the passage of the guard at night to see if there is no abuse no services

title: (04769) Berja - AL-6400
description: Place with a beautiful view overlooking the lake. It's very quiet here, even though the place is right next to the street. There's almost no traffic here in December. There are no toilets or trash bins here, so please take your waste with you. Very good mobile 4G-coverage.

title: (04729) Enix - 85 AL-3402
description: Esplanade where you can spend the night. Wide and quiet, just before the entrance to the Town of Enix.

title: (04740) Aguadulce - 8 Paseo Marítimo
description: Water source, to fill.

title: (18491) Barrio la Noria - Unnamed Road
description: Just at the end of the road before starting the park track, several places on the lower side, beware of the low vehicle...great view

title: (04720) Roquetas de Mar - 66 Calle Mauritania
description: Toilet and beach shower !!!

title: (04769) Berja - 11 Diseminado Pantano Beninar
description: A gravel surfaced wooded glen with a decent pull away from the road. A little uneven but we found a level spot. Nice and firm. Very quiet road we had a very peaceful night.

title: (04720) Aguadulce - 14 Calle Nebraska
description: Fairly quiet dirt parking at night being on the outskirts of the city, there are usually several motorhomes parked

title: (04729) El Marchal de Enix -
description: The site is on a gravel road that leads to a wind farm. (Dead end) The square is still part of the public, accessible part. Absolutely quiet at night. At 8:00 am, two workers drove to the wind farm. Beautiful views of the surrounding hills, perfect for watching the sunrise. The parking space is a bit sloping. But there are enough stones to find compensation there.

title: (04458) Fondón - Camino de las Cartagenas
description: Flat parking in the middle of nature, few people, flat and quiet, sandy, not paved.

title: (18491) Turón - Unnamed Road
description: Nice view to Sierra Nevada, quit and clean lost Industri-area. No Services.

name: Bodega Fuente Victoria
title: (04470) Bodega Fuente Victoria
description:
Huge parking lot next to a winery where you can stay overnight. Asphalt, flat terrain, very quiet location with beautiful views and the possibility of a wonderful wine tasting at Rosi and Pedro's.

Services for overnight stays in mobile homes:

Large arched esplanade
Toilets and water intake
Closure of the site at night
Shop and tasting of our wines

Opening hours:
Monday to Friday from 08:30 to 18:00

title: (04460) Fondón - 1 Calle Fuente
description: Water source

title: (04458) Almócita - Cam. de las Cartagenas
description: On the side of the road, very large recess. Total calm in the middle of the mountains.

title: (04460) Fondón - 1 Calle Francisco Godoy Calvo
description: We went to Fondón for the Chisco party and we found in the interior of the city, next to a school and a padel court, several streets full of motorhomes, a great place to go to the party and spend the night.

title: (04460) Fondón - 1 Calle San Marcos
description: A good place to park, it is dirt, flat and very quiet. to visit the perfect town.

title: (04778) Adra - 16 Calle la Marina
description: Beach near an abandoned school.

name: Camping Valle del Andarax
title: (04460) Camping Valle del Andarax
description: Fondón, Calle Adelfa. Small family campsite with a good restaurant. Common ground with a lot of shade, ideal for camping.

title: () Guainos -
description:
Side of road parking, in the mountains behind Guainos altos.
Very quiet, except for the bird song, and the distant sound of the waves hitting the beach. Room for 2 or 3 small camping cars, but not suitable for large camping cars. The road up here is very narrow and twisty. Fantastic spot to stargaze, or watch the sunrise.
Absolutely no services, please be respectful, and do not litter.

title: (04479) Fuente Victoria - 8 Avenida Fernando Hita
description: Drinking water fountain

title: (04569) Terque - A-391
description:
Flat, very quiet, spacious place at 950m altitude. Suitable for large vehicles. Away from the trees I had good TV and phone/internet reception.

I spent 3 hours to fill 13 x 30 litre bags with rubbish (very satisfying work!), so it looks a lot better now. 

Great hiking and cycling possibilities. Fantastic views from the nearby hills.

title: (04769) Turón - Unnamed Road
description: Superb place, surrounded by nature, no homes nearby and cut from the wind. Half-paved path, easy to access despite a slightly winding road

title: (04458) Padules - Unnamed Road
description: Parking to walk to Los Canales. A nice river bed with a cool looking bar, which is only open in summer I guess. There is a parking lot further down, but the road is getting very narrow. There is a water tap (working in 03/2020) and a rubbish bin.

title: (04720) Aguadulce - Unnamed Road
description: Place to park, there are no signs and it is quiet. At weekends there are usually young people out drinking.

name: Camping Almocita
title: (04458) Camping Almocita
description: Camping Almocita. Great location, warm welcome, nice little restaurant with tapas. Sanitary simple but correct. Very calm and great point of view.

title: (04778) Adra - 37 N-340a
description: Place to spend the night near the beach (quite nice). There is usually no problem with the police for sleeping there. The road can be a bit complicated depending on the time of year, although normally any vehicle can enter.

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 2 Calle Huertas
description: Parking level of asphalt quite large and far enough from the road so you do not hear traffic. 4 minutes walking from the center. Without any service, except garbage container.

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 3 Calle Almeria
description: Quiet parking without services, only trash containers. In the center of the town and away from the traffic of vehicles. The views to the valley are beautiful and the inhabitants of the town are very friendly. We recommend the bars of the town.

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 8 Calle San Miguel
title_short: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 8 Calle San Miguel
description: Middle parking was quietly in the village

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 23 Calle Alcazaba
description: Drinking water fountain in the shade with a bench next to it. Absolutely pleasant to take a short break.

title: (04458) Padules - Calle la Rueda
description: Free parking in the pretty village of Alpujarra Almeria. There is no service but there is no shortage of springs in the city. Bakery with wood bread and cellars where to eat and very good tapas. **** ATTENTION **** Access is via a very steep short slope where large vehicles will systematically have the overhang which will rub (strongly) to enter and exit!

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 4B Urbanizacion la Mateana
title_short: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - 4B Urbanizacion la Mateana
description: Fantastic place in the middle of nature, next to the river and near the town, entrance by rocky dirt track, but without major difficulty (passable by any vehicle), quite level and very clean (keep it up). Sunrise with songs of birds, purring of water and the sonorous dance of autumn leaves. Let's enjoy it.

title: (04458) Padules - 41 Calle Canario
description: Level dirt ground parking, there is a drinking fountain and an electric car charging point. It is next to a futsal court. Very good views of the fountain.

title: (04480) Alcolea - Calle Almazara
description: Parking in the city center.

title: (04430) Íllar - Unnamed Road
description: 'Mirador' with  amazing views over the valley. Clean with no services. 8km dirt road up the hill.

title: (04458) Almócita -
description: 360 ° view perfect for the night or quiet meal break, shade.

title: (04470) Láujar de Andarax - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking Láujar de Andarax pignic area. along the river, there are barbecues, dining tables. from this point, magnificent hiking trails are initiated by the southern side of the Sierra Nevada.
If you go on a weekend, it will cost you to find parking or you can leave out. You can sleep, but you will not be fine as it is a place without any problem.

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax - Unnamed Road
description: Mirador parking. Panorama. Away from everything, solitude and tranquility

title: (04470) Laujar de Andarax -
description: Large parking space by the river after a picnic area with several barbecues and a restaurant. After crossing the river, a steep but short climb provides access to the parking area, which is relatively horizontal.

title: (04729) Almería - Carretera de Almería
description: Nice view of the sea. We drove by by bike. This road is a bypass road for the tunnel behind it.

title: (04450) Canjáyar -
description: Recreational area with picnic areas, garbage cans and parking. There is a climbing wall.

title: (04729) El Palmer -
description: By the sea, corner below the road, next to a large hotel visibly undergoing renovation. It is calm and undoubtedly spending the night there is possible.

title: (04002) Almería - 659 Colegio Ur la Parra
description: Gravel site on the coast.

title: (04458) Beires - Unnamed Road
description: Small corner surrounded by greenery and trees, barbecue (only in winter) and the water source with small stream. great place to stop the day. Beware of large motorhomes, better park 50mtrs further back by the difficulty of turning around the place

title: (04770) Adra - Cortijo De La Juana
description: Very cool place... very secluded... good for several nights... making campfires possible... ATTENTION slope only possible for 4x4 or small mobile homes... Access is on dirt track under the giant bridge down... better expire before... right on the beach. Place not everywhere straight.

title: (04450) Canjáyar - A-348
description: 6 camper places on asphalt with gray water and drainage and drink everything completely free, on the edge of a small town. It looks peaceful, even though it borders on public scale and bomberos.

title: (04450) Canjáyar - AL-4402
description: Parking in the countryside with stunning views over Canjayar. Without service. Very quiet night and day too. Great walk and bike ride.

name: Camping La Garrofa
title: (04002) Camping La Garrofa
description: Camping la Garrofa. This is located at the water's edge in the bay called "La Garrofa" 4 km from the city of Almeria

title: (04430) Instinción - 124 Carretera Gador a Laujar
description: Parking next to the municipal swimming pool and sports facilities. Somewhat uneven, but quite acceptable. Very quiet at night, very noisy during the day, as there is a lot of vehicle traffic. Ideal if you come to do DH in the area.

title: (04409) Alicún - A-391
description: Nice viewpoint with parking for vans

title: (04431) Íllar - 6 Calle Antonio Andres Gonzalez
description: Drinking water

title: (18480) Ugíjar - 30 Carretera Almeria de Cherin
description: Explanade in front of to the headquarters of the civil guard, almost at ideal level to visit the town eye not to park very near the highway is something noisy.

title: (18480) Ugíjar - 9 Calle Pinilla
description: Motorhome area, for four (4) vehicles. The place has a point to fill drinking water, gray water and empty chemical toilet. Located at the entrance of the municipality, it is fenced and is accessed by opening a small latch that has the access door. You can reach the town center in just 10 minutes on foot. The town has several supermarkets and bakeries. Good place to make a stop along the way and even to sleep en route, and take a walk through its streets

title: (18700) Albuñol - Unnamed Road
description: Spot for one or two in the dry riverbed, mostly level. Super quiet. Obviously not accessible and available if there is water in the river. No shade, no services, little to no cell reception.

title: (04479) Paterna del Río - AL-5402
description: Nice quiet parking with view of the surrounding mountains. Great 4g reception. Recently renovated with new athletic equipment.

title: (04450) Canjáyar - AL-3404
description: Superb place with unique panorama! Large flat land No shade Very quiet!

title: (04450) Canjáyar - AL-3404
description: Superb point of view, one of the most beautiful that we found in Spain. very quiet night wide road and accessible to all type of vehicle. we recommend

name: Camping Camino Ancho
title: (04569) Camping Camino Ancho
description: * Please call to verify available parking space * Or WhatsApp ! Or message with Text .This site is a private farmhouse set in an orange grove, and is an excellent quiet retreat situated between two villages Terque and Bentarique which are both a 15 minute walk to either village, the farm is 40 minutes by car from Roquetas de Mar, the beaches and the coast, the site has 3 hard pitches as well as 3 apartments which can also be rented. It also offers spectacular views of the mountains and hills and the stars on the clear nights! There is also a large swimming pool, a Petanca court and a Table-tennis table which can be used with the owners' consent. The site is owned by an english couple (Jason and Paula) who go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible, overall the place is a great quiet site away from tourist routes ,but within some fantastic hills and valleys !Both villages have bars with good tapas and are good value for money, there are also small supermarkets in the two neighbouring villages, there is a village market in Terque on Tuesday morning.There are other nearby pueblos worth exploring by foot or bike ! The Maximum permitted width of the van is 2.9 metres and the MAXIMUM permitted length is approximately 7.1 metres .Maximum height is 2.9 metres.

title: (04400) Alhama de Almería - 3 Poligono Sector 1
description: Beautiful Alpujarra village with good cuisine and places to see as La Cascada, the water jet ...

title: (04569) Terque - 2 Calle Porras
description: Beautiful village with 4 museums

title: (04002) Almería - N-340a
description: Quiet parking by the sea, with outdoor shower and garbage cans

title: (04002) Almería - Calle de Coches
description: From Motril on the N340. Take the old road that bypasses the rock just before the tunnel. It's a cul de sac with a roundabout at the end. The latter overlooks a beautiful small pebbled beach. Well exposed to the sun from morning to evening.

title: (04002) Almería - 110 Carretera de Málaga
description: Good location to sleep one night. We arrive tonight from the boat line this place is very good to sleep and prepare the road for tomorrow. Very safe because right at the entrance of the Guardia Civil

title: (04479) Bayárcal - AL 5402
description: Very quiet, next to a cemetery, slightly sloping.

title: (18494) Laroles - 1 A-337
description: Esplanade next to the Laroles gas station. It is one of the few places where you can stop. beautiful views.

title: (04002) Almería - C. de Coches
description: This is a parking lot for the fishing post, don't worry, there is a division between the port and the parking lot, there are lights and it is very quiet, you can stay for a while, we stayed for 3 days and it takes 8 minutes by bike to the center, there is a track bike nearby. Highly recommended, let's try to leave clean and respect! Don't worry about the smell either, it doesn't smell like fish!!

title: (04002) Almería - 486 Calle de Coches
description: Guiding us by another area near this one, we decided to stop here for the night. It is inside the port without any restriction, it is a parking lot that has a maximum 24 hour signal. Cost 0 amenities 0.

name: Alpujarras Camping
title: (18494) Alpujarras Camping
description: Camping Alpujarras: Beautiful campsite, very quiet with a breathtaking view, warm welcome, Tino gave us very good tips and was always there for us. Sanitary clean, hot water available, nothing to complain about. We'd love to come back.

title: (18760) La Rábita - Unnamed Road
description: Parking along the beach, you can park with a sea view

title: (18760) La Rábita - 2D Calle la Fuente
description: Large parking lot next to the sea, ideal to know the area. There are restaurants that are not expensive and you eat very well.

title: (18760) La Rábita - Nº1, Bajo Calle Carretera
title_short: (18760) La Rábita - Nº1, Bajo Calle Carretera
description: Water source free

title: (04479) Bayárcal - AL-5402
description: Parking at the entrance to the village. Overlooking the valley. Superb view. Very calm and safe. Pretty village on the mountainside.

title: (18494) Andalusia - 33 A-4130
description: Area of coarse gravel with trees. Very nice views to the Valley

title: (04568) Alsodux - 10 Calle Maestro Pedro Aparicio
description: Parking for hike departure, no service

title: (04531) Alboloduy - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful spot in the middle of nowhere. Great if you like adventure:) The view is stunning and you will feel alone in the world. Amazing sunset and sunrise. The place is clean as can be. Please leave it like that.

title: (04001) Almería - Vía Muelle de Levante, s/n
title_short: (04001) Almería - Vía Muelle de Levante, s/n
description: It is located in the heart of Almeria city center, cameras. Guarded parking lot, next to the sea rescue tower

title: (18494) Laroles - A-337
description: Gravel pitch for an overnight stay with a view of the valley. Although it is on the road, it is hardly used at night. Maybe 5 cars passed. If this place is not flat enough for you, there is a second bay about 100m further up the mountain.

title: (58 04008) Almería - Diseminado Belen Rambla
description: Excellent parking space, next to a park, where you have benches and can walk. They are quite flat places. You are near the main road, but there is little noise pollution. Close by (150 meters) is a Repsol gas station where they sell gas bottles. Also a large waste bin (residual waste) here.

title: (04003) Almería - 20 Calle Burladero
description: There is a public drinking water dispenser here, the only one I found in the city. the water quality is rather inferior, it doesn't taste of chlorine but somehow unpleasant. like desalinated seawater, parking/stopping is no problem.

title: (04008) Almería - C. Morato
description: Free Parking next to the football stadium. Easy to explore Almería from here by bike. Not ideal for overnight stay, next to busy roundabout.

title: (04008) Almería - Acceso a A-7
description: Gas station

title: (04458) Beires - Unnamed Road
description: For a motorhome or van

title: (04568) Santa Cruz de Marchena - 10 Calle Gwnada
title_short: (04568) Santa Cruz de Marchena - 10 Calle Gwnada
description: Beautiful village by the Andarax river. only water and waste emptying.

title: (04479) Bayárcal - AL-5402
description: Parking for Motorhomes, with playground for children, bar, bicycle rental and zip line. There are not many shadows.

title: (04567) Alhabia - AL-3407
description: Many places along this wide but little used road with large road side pullover places. Extremely quiet. 4G coverage good but no other services

title: (04007) Almería - 29 Avenida de Cabo de Gata
title_short: (04007) Almería - 29 Avenida de Cabo de Gata
description: The free parking spot is close to the esplanade, a little skatepark and also has a water tap around the corner.

title: (04004) Almería - 191 Calle Soldado Español
description: Paid parking next to the train station. Ideal for visiting the city of Almería. Alcazaba castle and cathedral aprox. 20 min. by foot.

title: (04420) -
description: Parking of the archaeological site of Los Millares. starry nights and very quiet. to be straight you have to stop by the fence.

title: (18760) La Rábita - Carr de Almeria
description: Large area not flat but view of sea

title: (04459) Ohanes - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful location next to a splendid view on Almeria refuge and the coast rolling track only for van

title: (18494) - A-337
description: Spot with beautiful view of the valley. Attention bivouac only out of season. At the foot of the lookout "el picacho". No service. Thank you for leaving the place clean.

title: (18470) Válor - 12 Barrio Torrecilla
description: Quiet, flat parking near a hermitage and an ideal park for children

title: (18470) Válor - s/n Torrecilla
description: Parking next to a viewpoint on the outskirts of town. Very quiet to spend the night and with good views. The bad thing is that there is no shade

title: (04531) Alboloduy - 2 Diseminado Estraradio
description: nacimiento river, charming village with beautiful viewpoints and hiking trails. town with a restaurant and tapas.

title: (04567) Alsodux - AL-3407
description:
Endroit très calme avec vue sur le désert de tabernas plate forme au bord de la route superbe et très peu fréquentée ,quasiment pas
 de passage juste quelques cyclistes et 2 voitures . nous y avons passé 2 nuit tranquilles.

title: (04007) Almería - 17 Avenida de Madrid
description: Laundry with new machines and very clean premises a few meters from the car park next to the family park.

title: (04007) Almería - 171 Avenida de Cabo de Gata
title_short: (04007) Almería - 171 Avenida de Cabo de Gata
description:
Laundry Lavomatic.
Reasonably cared for. Vending machines work with euro coins.

title: (04007) Almería - 185 Avenida de Cabo de Gata
title_short: (04007) Almería - 185 Avenida de Cabo de Gata
description:
This is a beautiful spot right next to the beach drinking water tap very close to launderette bars restaurants and small shops across the Road 5-minutes to supermarket beautiful walk down the front everybody friendly the police patrol 2-3 times a night very safe we have stayed here 3 nights fantastic highly recommended what more can I say
you have to come early in the morning or late at night to get the place
there is a sign saying no motorhome but this time of year you are  ok no problems February and March don't know about April

title: (04007) Almería - 15 Avenida Alhambra
description: Water source. Impossible to park, you have to look for water on foot

title: (04007) Almería - 2 Calle Olula del Río
description: It is a gas station that has a tap to refill water, the tap has very little water flow, it takes time to fill a 50-liter tank 17 minutes but it is fine for an emergency, the water is not drinkable, it puts it on the poster but it is very very clean and you can shower with it without problems

title: (18700) Albuñol - 35D Calle San Antonio
description: Public parking limited to the market on the 10th and 25th of each month is prohibited. All services in the town of Buñol. Gas station with propane and drinking water for motorhome tank.

title: (04007) Almería - 6 Calle Ferrobus
description: Large parking lot next to Lidl. 30 minutes walk from the old quarter. 10 mins from the beach. No place for a motorhome, just for a van

title: (04006) Almería - 150 Calle Santiago
description: Parking in Almería town.  Good for Almería itself but especially good if you have a hospital appointment at Bola Azul.   Free overnight opposite hospital.   No amenities.

title: (04007) Almería - 20 Calle Jaúl
description:
Very large parking lot, a
 September almost totally free

title: (04007) Almería - 39 Avenida del Mediterráneo
description: Close to the beach… motorhomes are accepted here but without camping! No Chairs and awnings, no bbqs etc…. Just a good spot for day and night parking to visit a beautiful place

title: (04006) Almería - 10 Carrera del Doctoral
description: Repsol with free water

title: (18700) Albuñol - 10 Carretera Visillo
description: Ample, central and free parking. Ideal to know the town and surroundings. No services

title: (04006) Almería - Calle Emilio Campra Bonillo
description: Extensive parking online and without much traffic. Services are Carrefour and gym which on the side

title: (04009) Almería - 87 Calle Antonio Cano
description: Car park at the shopping center, Alcampo petrol station right next door, Almeria's best price for fuel. Crowded during Christmas time.

title: (04007) Almería - 1 Calle Almijares
description: Source of water

title: (04007) Almería - 182 Camino Jaúl Bajo
description: Quiet parking to spend the night and spend the day, near the beach (5min walk) and supermarket (1min). There are no noises from cars, people disturbing or police. It is paved and is spacious for camper and AC.

title: (04007) Almería - Av. de Cabo de Gata, 280
title_short: (04007) Almería - Av. de Cabo de Gata, 280
description: Large manual car wash with 4m height. Total 3 places to wash your motorhome. They offer 4 steps: 1. Water + shampoo, 2. Water, 3. Water + wax, 4. Clear water to finish.

title: (04007) Almería - Av. de Cabo de Gata
title_short: (04007) Almería - Av. de Cabo de Gata
description: Large paved car park next to a playground without services facing the sea and the bike path. No sign prohibiting parking and spending the night. Cars and campers rub shoulders. Quiet place after 7 p.m.

title: (18440) Cádiar - A-345
description: Small parking area off the A345 with stunning views of the mountains. Nothing to do but relax and enjoy the views. No services and no rubbish bins. Room for a couple of motorhomes. Most of the surface is gravel but could get muddy in wet weather

title: (18460) Yegen - Unnamed Road
description: Superb view of the Sierra Nevada. 30 seconds from the main road, flat.

title: (04009) Almería - 4R Calle García de Villarroel
description: Good place to park and spend the night. Next to the Torrecardenas hospital. There are no services of any kind, the only one in the surrounding bar. It is about 15 minutes walk to the center of the city of Almeria.

title: (18460) Yegen -
description: Spot below the road, accessible by a path that descends from the watchtower. access is quite easy, however there is a channel to pass at the start of the path, to see for large motorhomes... Flat space which can accommodate several vehicles. You can hear the road above slightly but nothing disturbing. Very nice point of view!! Some trash on the floor

title: (18470) Válor - A-4130
description: La Casa de Lareda, very small car park of 5 motorhomes maximum with an exceptional panoramic view. Very warm welcome by English speaking owners. Pool and bar with drinks at very good prices

title: (04120) El Bobar -
description: Parking next to a park. Also suitable for large campers. 4 car parks along the road adjacent to the park.
